feature1.explanation: Both texts use punctuation marks such as commas and exclamation marks, but the usage differs significantly.

feature2.explanation: Text 1 has a formal and structured lexical and grammatical style typical of automated responses, while Text 2 contains more informal and expressive language with capitalized phrases.

feature3.explanation: Text 1 has short, straightforward sentences, typical of automated responses, whereas Text 2 has more complex and dramatic sentence structures.

feature4.explanation: Text 1 has a neutral and informative tone, while Text 2 carries a sense of excitement and drama.

feature5.explanation: Both texts are free of spelling and typographical errors.

overall.explanation: Considering the differences in punctuation style, lexical and grammatical features, sentence structure, text and discourse features, and the presence of spelling errors, the likelihood of the two texts being written by the same author is low.
